column1: #Text=The 2018 FIFA World Cup was held in Russia from 14 June – 15 July 2018 .
#Text=confederations played 64 matches in 12 venues spread out among 11 cities .
#Text=All but one of the stadium venues were in European Russia , west of the Ural Mountains to keep travel time manageable .
#Text=The final tournament involved 32 national teams , which included 31 teams determined through qualifying competitions and the host team ( Russia ) which qualified automatically .
#Text=The final was won by France on 15 July at the Luzhniki Stadium in Moscow .
#Text=Last-minute sales will be open until 15 July 2018 .
#Text=You can apply online for 2018 FIFA World Cup Russia tickets .
#Text=Tickets are sold on a first-come , first-served basis and subject to availability .
#Text=A traffic light system on FIFA.com/tickets will give fans an indication about ticket availability .

#Text=Due to the launch of the official ticket resale platform and the possible release of ticket inventories reserved for selected FIFA constituent groups , tickets for specific matches , which at some point could be unavailable , may possibly become available again at FIFA.com/tickets .
#Text=( FVTC ) are open in all 2018 FIFA World Cup Host Cities .
#Text=You can purchase tickets over the counter at the FVTCs , depending on availability .

#Text=The general visa policy of Russia will not apply to the World Cup participants and fans , who will be able to visit Russia without a visa right before and during the competition regardless of their citizenship .
#Text=Although all of the matches will be held in European Russia , the distances between the cities are vast .
#Text=You can comfortably travel between the cities in the Central core region on the overnight trains , but if you are going to Kaliningrad or Sochi , flying is your best option .
#Text=The following cities will play host to matches during the tournament :
#Text=Local time : UTC+2 ( similar to CEST ) in Kaliningrad , UTC+4 in Samara , UTC+5 in Yekaterinburg and UTC+3 ( similar to EEST ) in other cities , including Moscow .
#Text=Of the 32 teams , 20 also played in the last tournament in 2014 , including defending champions Germany .
#Text=Iceland and Panama will be making their first appearances at a FIFA World Cup .

#Text=Other teams returning after absences of at least three tournaments include : Egypt , returning to the finals after a 28-year absence from their last appearance in 1990 ; Morocco , who last competed in 1998 ; Peru , returning after a 36-year absence ( since 1982 ) ; and Senegal , competing for the second time after reaching the quarter-finals in 2002 .
#Text=It is the first time three Nordic countries ( Denmark , Iceland and Sweden ) and four Arab nations ( Egypt , Morocco , Saudi Arabia and Tunisia ) have qualified for the World Cup .
#Text=Notable countries that failed to qualify include four-time champions Italy ( for the first time since 1958 ) and three-time runner-up Netherlands .
#Text=Four reigning continental champions failed to qualify : 2017
#Text=Africa Cup of Nations winner Cameroon , two-time Copa América champion and 2017
#Text=OFC Nations Cup winner New Zealand , and 2017 CONCACAF Gold Cup champion United States ( for the first time since 1986 ) .
#Text=The other notable qualifying streaks broken were for Ghana and Ivory Coast , who had both made the previous three tournaments .
#Text=Confederation of North , Central American and Caribbean Association Football ( CONCACAF ) ( 3 ) :

#Text=Of the 12 venues used , the Luzhniki Stadium in Moscow and the Saint Petersburg Stadium ( the two largest stadiums in Russia ) will be used most , with 7 matches being played at each of these stadiums .

#Text=Sochi , Kazan , Nizhny Novogrod and Samara will host 6 matches including one quarter-final match apiece , and the Otkrytiye Stadium in Moscow and Rostov-on-Don will host 5 matches apiece including one round of 16 match each .
#Text=Volgograd , Kaliningrad , Yekaterinburg and Saransk will host 4 matches each and none of these cities will host any knockout stage games .

#Text=The official FIFA World Cup mascot for the 2018 tournament , a wolf named Zabivaka ( " the one who scores " in Russian ) , represents an anthropomorphic wolf with brown and white wool T-shirt with the words " RUSSIA 2018 " and orange sport glasses .
#Text=The combination of white , blue and red T-shirt and shorts are the national colors of the Russian team .
#Text=The student designer is Ekaterina Bocharova , and the mascot was selected by Internet voting .
#Text=The full schedule was announced by FIFA on 24 July 2015 ( without kick-off times , which were confirmed later ) .
#Text=On 1 December 2017 , following the final draw , six kick-off times were adjusted by FIFA .

#Text=Russia was placed in position A1 in the group stage and will play in the opening match at the Luzhniki Stadium in Moscow on 14 June against Saudi Arabia , the two lowest ranked teams of the tournament at the time of the final draw .
#Text=The Luzhniki Stadium will also host the second semi-final on 11 July and the final on 15 July .
#Text=The Krestovsky Stadium in Saint Petersburg will host the first semi-final on 10 July and the third place play-off on 14 July .
